intro: Galium nitens, commonly known as the silverweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Galium nitens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
